definition: Hoover (name)/Herbert Hoover (1874-1964) US mining engineer and Republican politician, president (1929-1933)
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])

sentences.english: Like Bush, Hoover is said to have become depressed.
sentences.chinese: 像布什一样，据说胡佛变得郁郁寡欢。

sentences.english: I’m thinking of what Herbert Hoover faced during the Great Depression.
sentences.chinese: 我想到了赫伯特胡佛在大萧条中所面对的境况。

sentences.english: Yet he, like Hoover, is the candidate of the incumbent party.
sentences.chinese: 但是，和胡佛一样，他毕竟是共和党的成员。

sentences.english: Hoover left the cabinet in nineteen twenty-five.
sentences.chinese: 胡佛离开一九二五年内阁。

sentences.english: Hoover was married to his job and zealously protective of his public image.
sentences.chinese: 胡佛娶了他的工作，狂热地维护自己的公众形象。

sentences.english: Shanty-towns of unemployed men were now called"Hoovervilles".
sentences.chinese: 失业者居住的贫民区现在被称为“胡佛村”。

sentences.english: Fear intensified during the interregnum between Herbert Hoover and Franklin D.
sentences.chinese: 恐惧在胡佛和罗斯福任期的中间期得到加强。

sentences.english: Hoover’s indecisiveness handed his successor a triumph at the very start of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 胡佛的优柔寡断让他的继任得以在履新伊始旗开得胜。
胡佛留下的遗风毁誉参半。

sentences.english: And now for Uncommon Knowledge, and Hoover institution, Thanks for joining us.
sentences.chinese: 代表非常道节目，和胡佛研究院，感谢收看。

sentences.english: This is why Hoover's high-wage policy proved so disastrous.
sentences.chinese: 这就是胡佛的高工资政策产生灾难性后果的原因。

sentences.english: Hosted by president Hoover, the evening was reported to be glittering success.
sentences.chinese: 晚宴由胡佛总统主持，据报道举办地非常成功。

sentences.english: I climb and reposition for my last maneuver, the Hoover Pitch.
sentences.chinese: 我爬高并改平准备最后一个机动动作，即胡佛摇摆。

sentences.english: Roosevelt accepted and met personally with Hoover three times prior to his inauguration.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯福欣然接受，并在就职前三次与胡佛亲自会面。

sentences.english: Hoover was inept at politics as he was superb administration.
sentences.chinese: 胡佛精于管理而拙于政治。

sentences.english: Hoover, at his death, left Tolson most of his estate.
sentences.chinese: 胡佛死后，大部分房产都留给了托尔森。

definition: Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Kennedy (name)/J.F. Kennedy (1917-1963), US Democrat politician, president 1961-1963
Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Bush (name)/George H.W. Bush (1924-2018), US president 1988-1992/George W. Bush (1946-), US President 2000-2008
Marshall (name)/George Catlett Marshall (1880-1959), US general in WWII and Secretary of State 1947-1949, author of the postwar Marshall plan for Europe and Nobel peace laureate
